sentences.english: They found themselves in a passive position under attack.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现自己处于被动挨打的局面。

sentences.english: The workers were frequently beaten and were forced to live in prison-like conditions.
sentences.chinese: 工人们经常挨打挨饿，被迫在监牢般的环境中生活。

sentences.english: The police come at night and beat adults and children.
sentences.chinese: 晚上警察会进来，不管成年还是孩子都会挨打。

sentences.english: The beaten dog crawled to his masters feet.
sentences.chinese: 挨打的狗爬到主人的脚边去。

sentences.english: There are some things pigs actually automatically don't like, like being hit or shocked.
sentences.chinese: 有些东西是猪天生就不喜欢的，比如挨打或受到惊吓。

sentences.english: Behind will be beaten, finance major can be rude.
sentences.chinese: 落后就要挨打，财大才能气粗。

sentences.english: Poverty and backwardness, it is necessary defensive.
sentences.chinese: 贫穷落后，就要被动挨打。

sentences.english: Flinching is preparation for being hit.
sentences.chinese: 闪躲是对挨打所做的准备。

sentences.english: If you don't stop disturbing,your buttocks would be spanked.
sentences.chinese: 如果你还不停止捣乱的话，你的屁股就该挨打了。

sentences.english: That child is receiving [undergoing] a beating.
When my father was a child he suffered hunger and cold and was often cursed and beaten.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸小时候忍饥受寒，还经常挨打挨骂。

sentences.english: The wife was bleeding profusely and several of her teeth had been knocked out.
sentences.chinese: 挨打的老婆血流如注，好几颗牙都被打掉了。

sentences.english: My oddness my memory in unexpectedly have no once the scene for suffering beating.
sentences.chinese: 我奇怪我的记忆里竟然没有一次挨打的情景。

sentences.english: If you're hit, you don't flinch.
sentences.chinese: 如果你挨打的时候并不闪躲。

sentences.english: The boy doesn't want to catch [get] a toco.
sentences.chinese: 打起架来，最小的男孩通常要挨打。

sentences.english: A child will relate spanking to hitting.
sentences.chinese: 孩子会把挨打和攻击联系在一起。
